arts.ttl: Birmingham City ‘paid the price’ for tactic and Chris Davies repeats message to players
arts.sum: Davies believes Iwata’s error was down to a combination of Blues insisting on playing out to their left to target Cameron McGeehan and the bobbling pitch at Sixfields – but he absolved his players of any blame. Chris Davies was speaking after his Birmingham City side played out a 1-1 draw with Northampton Town

arts.ttl: Chris Davies makes Willum Willumsson admission in assessment of Birmingham City draw
arts.sum: Chris Davies thinks Birmingham City have played worse and won away from home this season after failing to get past Northampton Town for the second time. Blues improved after Anderson’s goal and had chances to win the game in the final 15 minutes that weren’t taken.

arts.ttl: Birmingham held as Northampton produce impressive display
arts.sum: Tomoki Iwata’s own goal gave the Cobblers a deserved lead before Keshi Anderson levelled.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies makes frank Tyler Roberts admission ahead of striker's Birmingham City return
arts.sum: Chris Davies has all but closed the door on a route back into the Birmingham City fold for Tyler Roberts. Chris Davies makes frank Tyler Roberts admission ahead of striker's Birmingham City return

arts.ttl: Sampsted starts again as Davies makes one change - Predicted Birmingham City XI for Northampton - Alex Dicken - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Sampsted, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Iwata, Paik; Dowell, Willumsson, Anderson; Stansfield Northampton Town are one of three teams in League One that Blues haven’t managed to beat across their mammoth 48-game season to date.

arts.ttl: There are 57 reasons why Davies has to address Birmingham City transfer issue
arts.sum: On this week’s Keep Right On Podcast, Blues reporter Alex Dicken said: “I don’t think Chris Davies has been able to get four players playing perfectly together at any one time and we all know he would probably rather not make changes. Collectively, Blues' wide players have missed 57 games this season through injury.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies gives Emil Hansson and Ethan Laird injury updates
arts.sum: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies gives Emil Hansson and Ethan Laird injury updates Hansson was withdrawn at half-time in Blues’ win over Stevenage on Tuesday with a calf complaint but Chris Davies has confirmed the Swedish winger is available for the Northampton game.

arts.ttl: Keshi Anderson restored as Birmingham City XI predicted for Northampton
arts.sum: (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Sampsted, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Iwata, Paik; Dowell, Willumsson, Anderson; Stansfield Northampton are one of three teams in League One that Blues haven’t managed to beat across their mammoth 48-game season to date.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City Women: 'Annoying' break as Amy Merricks lauds January signing
arts.sum: Birmingham City Women: 'Annoying' break as Amy Merricks lauds January signing Quinn said: “It’s a little bit annoying when you’ve just won and scored a couple of goals but you’ve just got to go into training and work together as a team.

arts.ttl: Kevin Nolan sets Birmingham City target and addresses Tyler Roberts fears
arts.sum: Kevin Nolan has challenged his Northampton Town side to make Sixfields a fortress – starting with a positive result against League One leaders Birmingham City. Northampton manager Kevin Nolan has been speaking ahead of Birmingham City's trip to Sixfields in League One
